intro: Onychium tenue, commonly known as the slender onychium, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and hairy, often reddish stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, which bloom in the summer months. Onychium tenue thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species in alpine botany.
